title: Linux mzip Command with Practical Examples
description: Explore the mzip command in Linux, learn how to compress and extract files and directories using this versatile tool, and gain practical experience with real-world examples.

meta.title: Linux mzip Command with Practical Examples
meta.description: Explore the mzip command in Linux, learn how to compress and extract files and directories using this versatile tool, and gain practical experience with real-world examples.
meta.keywords: Linux, mzip, compression, extraction, file management, directory operations

verify.name: Verify mzip command is installed
verify.hint:
The mzip command is part of the mtools package. Please install the mtools package using the following command:
sudo apt-get install -y mtools

steps.title: Compress Files and Directories Using mzip

verify.name: Verify sample_archive.mz creation
verify.hint: Make sure you have created the sample_archive.mz file using the mzip -c command.

verify.name: Verify sample_archive.mz contents
verify.hint: Make sure the mzip -l command shows the expected files and directories in the sample_archive.mz file.

steps.title: Extract Compressed Files and Directories with mzip

verify.name: Verify sample_archive.mz extraction
verify.hint: Make sure you have extracted the sample_archive.mz file using the mzip -x command. The extracted files and directories should be present in the current directory.
